name: Bogota Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: Wow! This is a great hotel. If you have stayed at the J.W properties you would agree with me this could very well fit into the category. Superb everything: service, food, decor, etc. Yes, everything works and the comfort is outstanding.
reviews.title: Superb! I think they forgot to add the J.W. to the Marriott Sign

reviews.text: One drawback is the location if you want to stay close to the restaurant areas but why bother the sushi bar is really good, also try the italian.
reviews.title: One of the very best Marriotts

reviews.text: I have traveled to Colombia for 28 years and this hotel tops any I have stayed in this country. Hope it stays like that.

reviews.text: I stayed at Marriott Bogota for three nights and had a wonderful time. The rooms are spacious and everything seems to be quite modern. The hotel is located 10 minutes away from the airport and it's a nice neighborhood. It has a few nearby restaurants that are also worth visiting: Buffalo Wings has great food and it's around the corner.
reviews.title: Modern and beautiful place to stay

reviews.text: I look forward for my next stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Colombia´s best hotel!!

reviews.text: I stay there every single month since they opened last year.
reviews.title: Soooo nice! I did not want to leave....

reviews.text: The staff is super friendly and go the extra mile to help you out, The breakfast is to die for, they make amazing croissants, different types of bread and lots of pastries. their pancakes are some of the best I´ve eaten. Their rooms are so comfortable with a nice king bed and lots of pillows,the smell of verbena.makes you relaxed as soon as you enter the hotel. Internet is a bit pricey but they run their operations as if you were in the US (you have to sign a form if you want medium-well cooked burger). I really recommend this hotel, is located close to the airport so it may be a bit far (20 min taxi) from the north part of the city but this hotel is worth the trip.
reviews.title: One of the best Marriotts in the world!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March during a business trip. It was not long enough... I travel a lot for business in Latin America, and I have to say this is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The Radisson also in Bogota is also up there. It's beautiful, great service, nice restaurants with excellent food, super comfortable beds, impeccable bathroom facilities. I so wanted to go to the gym, but ran out of time. But the place looked amazing! I highly recommend this hotel for the proximity to the airport, and if you are doing business in that area.
reviews.title: Beautiful new with internet nuissances

reviews.text: Killings and kidnappings have improved dramatically in Colombia thanks to the get-tough policies of President Uribe. But arriving to the hotel reminds you that threats remain: Security staff pass a hand wand over your body, and a dog sniffs you for drugs. I suppose it's the same at most big international hotels these days in Bogota.
reviews.title: good not great

reviews.text: I paid $220 or so a night and felt like it was a bit expensive. Small things didn't add up: the printer in the business center was broken, they mixed up my bill at breakfast, the elevators take a long time to arrive. As I said, those are small things, but you expect Marriott to get them right.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel - great service!

reviews.text: The room was fine, and the hotel interior, too. They provided good service, quickly correcting the breakfast mix-up and finding another way for me to print a document.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service

reviews.text: The Internet was not free.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: The hotel is located around the corner from several restaurants on a busy avenue and is close to the airport and the US Embassy. But it's a 30-minute drive to the 7th Carrera, where I had to see a bunch of people.

description: The modern hotel Bogota Marriott, located in the new financial and entertainment center of Salitre, is just 10 minutes away from International Airport El Dorado. The hotel offers the highest speed Internet Access available. Exclusive sound proof windows in rooms guarantee you the best rest. Our 239 rooms are provided with 300-thread count Egyptian cotton linen as well as a down feather mattress topper to offer maximum comfort and enjoy a unique experience in relaxation. Visit Pimento, a exquisite and elegant Italian food restaurant or Tanoshii, our sushi and tapas bar to kick back, have a drink, and enjoy your favorite music. Stepping out of this Luxury hotel you will find two of the most important and recognized shopping malls in Bogota and also the Chamber of Commerce. Maloka Interactive center and Salitre Magico amusement park are just minutes away from the hotel.
